text: Ari Ne'eman (pronounced neh-uh-MAHN; born December 10, 1987) is an American autism rights activist. He was born in East Brunswick, New Jersey. After he graduated from high school he started the Autistic Self Advocacy Network. Ne'eman was nominated by President Obama to the National Council on Disability in 2009. ==References== Category:1987 births Category:People on the autism spectrum Category:American activists Category:People from East Brunswick, New Jersey Category:Living people Category:Disability activists
title: Ari Ne'eman
